Joseph R. Peterson

Employment

Software Consultant

West Valley City, UT, USA
2013 to Present

I have developed embedded software for several biomedical devices. This required close collaboration with device engineers and agile development practices. Software documentation was tailored for FDA submission.

Graduate Research Assistant, Luthey-Schulten Laboratory

University of Illinois at Urbana-Champaign, Champaign, IL, USA
2012 to Present

I currently study biology at the level of single cells and colonies using a variety of analytical and computational techniques. This work primarily focuses on metabolism and regulation of methanogenic microbes and E. coli. I have recently begun modeling biofilms. During this work I have created and/or maintained a number of scientific and simulation software packages (3DdFBA Tools, Lattice Microbes). This work has resulted in 9 publications, so far.

Undergraduate Research Assistant, Berzins Laboratory

University of Utah, Salt Lake City, UT, USA
2011 to 2013

Devised high performance computing methods for partitioning scientific simulation algorithms between CPUs and GPUs on supercomputers. This work resulted in 1 publication.

Undergraduate Research Assistant, Wight Laboratory

University of Utah, Salt Lake City, UT, USA
2008-2012

Designed combustion and detonation models for solid explosives applicable to the investigation of hazard mitigation schemes for the transport and storage of explosives. This work resulted in 5 publication.
